name: Katri Inkeri: Meteor pendant
description: Handmade pendant by Helsinki-based designer Katri Inkeri. http://katri-inkeri.tumblr.com/ Materials: varnished/ hand painted polymer clay, cotton thread, waxed cotton cord Measures: approximately 5cm x 6cm, length of cord 82cm Please notice that the size may vary as each piece is made by hand.

name: Giada Ganassin: You are cute
description:
The winner of the Napa Flipbook Competition 2013! 

144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm

(Orders will be sent on Dec 10th)

name: Solmu earrings
description: Solmu (=Knot in Finnish) earrings handmade by Finnish jewelry designer Salla Silvonen. Salla works at the jewelry studio at Napa & Paja. Earrings made from cotton thread, lock from Sterling silver. Available in three colours: gold, turquoise and red. Diameter approx. 1 cm. www.birdofpassage.fi

name: Blanco flipbook
description: We have made you a flipbook with empty pages so now you can easily take part in the Napa Flipbook Competition. Front cover is completely white, four different colours on the back: Blue, red, grey or yellow 144 empty pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm

name: Kauniste Note Card Set by Hanna Konola
description:
Set of 10 note cards and envelopes
2 cards of each design
Illustrated by Hanna Konola

Card size: 12,5cm x 12,5cm
Printed with vegetable based inks 
on environmentally friendly paper 
by Kauniste, 2013

name: Kauniste Wall Calendar 2014 by Hanna Konola
description:
Retki wall calendar for the year 2014
Illustrated by Hanna Konola

Size: 17cm x 30cm
Printed with vegetable based inks
on environmentally friendly paper
by Kauniste, 2013

name: Kauniste kitchen towel 'Kuma' by Miroco Machiko
description:
Kuma is Japanese for bear. Kuma towel is designed by Miroco Machiko, an illustrator and artist from Osaka, Japan.

Kauniste works with young Scandinavian designers to create beautiful longlasting textiles.

Silkscreen printed in Helsinki.
Linen 55% Cotton 45%
Size 47cm x 69 cm
Material: 55%linen & 45%cotton
Size: 45cm x 70cm

Available in green and purple color

name: Kauniste kitchen towel ' Calendar 2014' by Sanna Mander
description:
Kauniste works with young Scandinavian designers to create beautiful longlasting textiles.

Sanna Mander is an illustrator living and working in Helsinki, Finland.

Silkscreen printed in Helsinki.
Linen 55% Cotton 45%
Size 47cm x 69 cm

name: Kauniste Kitchen towel 'Zoo' by Matti Pikkujämsä
description:
Kauniste works with young Scandinavian designers to create beautiful longlasting textiles.

Matti Pikkujämsä is an illustrator living and working in Helsinki, Finland. 

Silkscreen printed in Helsinki.
Linen 55% Cotton 45%
Size 47cm x 69 cm

name: Terhi Ekebom: Kummituslapsi
description: Terhi Ekebomin riipaiseva, sadunomainen sarjakuvaromaani on kertomus hylkäämisestä ja löytämisestä. Ekebomin pysäyttävän kaunis kuvakerronta on vailla vertaa ja usein myös vailla sanoja. Kummituslapsi on Ekebomin viides sarjakuvateos.

name: Misaki Kawai: New Era Activities
description:
Misaki Kawai (b. 1978 in Osaka, Japan) works with painting, drawing, sculpture, installations and artists’ books. Her works are filled with colourful characters, who appear to come from the dream world of film, music and comics.

New Era Activities is an activity book for kids - produced by the Malmö Konsthall for the EU Project 'ARTOOLS' in 2011.

Full colour on heavy stock
28 pages, 20 x 20 cm
Yarn + pom pom bound

www.misakikawai.com

name: Nathalie Du Pasquier: Square Paintings
description:
"The book Square Paintings is made from a selection of my oil paintings made between 2001 and 2012. Painting ‘still life’ is very quiet, just like the name. I represent objects, they don’t talk, they don’t move, they don’t change except with the light. I install them in front of me, building a little ‘set’, and then I paint them. The most recent paintings represent things I have constructed, so they look a bit different because people don’t know what the objects are and the paintings look less like ‘still life’ paintings even though they are." Nathalie Du Pasquier

Nathalie Du Pasquier was born in Bordeaux (France) in 1957, she lives in Milan (Italy) since 1979. Until 1986 she worked as a designer and is a founding member of Memphis. She designed numerous ‘Decorated Surfaces’: Textiles, carpets, plastic laminates, and some furniture and objects. In 1987 painting became her main activity. 

24 Pages, 24.5 x 24.5 cm, Color Offset, First Edition 2013

http://www.nathaliedupasquier.com

name: Maija Luutonen: Works
description: The latest book in A5 series introduces new works by the talented Helsinki artist Maija Luutonen. Her subtle works on paper often address the relationship between the viewer and the work by the scale and space they inhabit. This book was released on the occasion of Maija's solo show at the SIC gallery in Helsinki in May 2012. Be sure to see the show at L3 before 17th June 2012! Size A5, 32 full color pages, edition of 300 copies, published by Napa Books, 2012. www.maijaluutonen.com

name: Riikka Sormunen: Big Mother #3
description: Riikka Sormunen is a young Finnish talent in illustration, currently living and working in Berlin. She has taken part in various group exhibitions around the world, including Pick Me Up London 2012, and has worked for leading periodicals and newspapers, including The New York Times and The Guardian. Printed on the finest sustainably sourced paper, this beautiful publication is a large A3 format, opening up to huge A2 double page spreads. Big Mother #3 can be read as a book or easily dissembled into individual artworks. 24 pages, Saddle stitched, Edition 2000 (hand-numbered), 2013. Published by Nobrow in London Riikka is represented by Napa Illustrations: www.napaillustrations.com www.riikkas.com

name: Planner by mmmg
description:
A medium-sized planner with soft, waterproof cover. Comes with protective plastic cover that features inside pockets for storing tickets, receipts, loose papers, etc. Size 14,8 x 21 cm

This planner features blank dates for you to fill in, and
14 monthly spreads
57 weekly spreads

Designed and made in Korea by mmmg

name: Pocket Planner by mmmg
description:
Neat little planner to organise your week and fit it in your back pocket. The pages are undated, so you can start whenever you choose. In its little sleeve it's about 9cm x 13cm. 

Pages:
Monthly x 13
Weekly x 56

name: Font Walk Map
description:
With the Font Walk Map you can take a stroll up and down the streets of Helsinki's central Kamppi area. The map points out details and explores the visual role of graphic design in the streetscape with thirty-one destinations illustrating the past and present of typography and graphic design. The map also offers you a glimpse of the micro history of the area!

Edited by Katri Paakkanen & Camilla Pentti.
Design & Illustration by Camilla Pentti

The Font Walk was part of the official program of Helsinki Design Capital 2012

name: Helsinki Beyond Dreams
description:
Helsinki Beyond Dreams is a book about urban culture and how it can make a difference. Edited by Hella Hernberg, the book includes essays by a culturally varied group of urban activists, thinkers, designers and artists.

172 x 226 mm, 204 color pages
Hard cover with dust jacket
Published by Urban Dream Management
Second edition, 2013

name: Napa Books Tote Bag
description:
Black canvas tote bag with long or short handles. 
White (organic cotton) canvas tote bag with long handles.

Hand printed at in Helsinki, 2013

name: Teeth pendant
description: Handmade unique pendants made by Helsinki-based artist Jenni Rope. Materials: Polymer clay, silver-plated metal, grey leather band Polymer clay parts' length: 9-12 cm Leather band length: 100 cm (adjustable) www.jennirope.com

name: Kaari brooch
description: Kaari (=Arch in Finnish) brooches are handmade by Finnish jewelry designer Elli Hukka. Elli works at the jewelry studio at Napa & Paja. The brooch is made from recycled colour pencils. Each brooch is unique, so the colours may vary slightly from the picture! Available in three beautiful colour combinations. Measures approx. 6 x 2 x 1 cm. www.ellihukka.com

name: Sotku earrings
description: Sotku (=Mess in Finnish) earrings are handmade by Finnish jewelry designer Anne Kokkonen. Anne works at the jewelry studio at Napa & Paja. Earrings are made from Sterling silver. Each earring is unique, so the shape may vary slightly from the picture! Diameter is approx. 1-1.2 cm. www.kokoru.net

name: Pencil necklace
description: The necklace is handmade by Finnish jewelry designer Elli Hukka. Elli works at the jewelry studio at Napa & Paja. The necklace is made from recycled colour pencils. Each necklace is unique, so it may vary slightly from the picture! www.ellihukka.com

name: Allison Schulnik: Eager Too
description: "I paint rejects, misfits and their landscapes. My fixation on these characters is not intended to exploit deficiencies, but to find valor in adversity. Whether hobo clowns, misshapen animals or scarecrows, they are usually built upon a human frame, often times the frame of myself, loved ones and sometimes people I have never met, which at times give them an awkward humanity." Allison Schulnik 16 Pages, 19.5 x 25.5 cm, Color Offset, First Edition 2013 www.allisonschulnik.com

name: MOMO in 74 pieces
description: 160 pages of murals, sketches, drawings and installations by MOMO, our favourite American artist known for his abstract graffiti wall works. Size: 24x17 cm, 160 fullcolor pages, hardcover www.momoshowpalace.com Published by Studiocromie, 2012

name: Laura Geurten: It's just a phase you're going through
description: The winner of the Napa Flipbook Competition 2012! "Well made animation, storyline and unique drawing style come together in this fine flipbook." said the jury. Laura Geurten is a Belgian illustrator living and working in Antwerpen. 144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm, 2012 www.laurageurten.com

name: Kati Rapia: Another Miracle Baby
description:
A sequel to the legendary Miracle Baby flipbook from 2005. 

Kati Rapia is and artist, illustrator and photographer living and working in Loviisa, Finland.
 
144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm, 2012

name: Manner's Safety Reflector
description:
Long-awaited Safety Reflector by Manner's. Very healthy thing to have when walking in the city at night. And it really works too, as Finnish Health Institute has inspected and approved. 

Sari Manner is a Helsinki-based designer of leather bags and accessories.

name: Studio Visit / 18 artists' studios in Helsinki
description: Studio Visit book takes you on a tour to visit 18 inspiring Finnish artists’ studios around Helsinki. The book includes detailed documentary of the studios by photographer Tuukka Kaila, as well as discussions on studio practice edited by artist/publisher Jenni Rope. Featured artists: Stig Baumgartner, Eeva-Leena Eklund, Petri Eskelinen, Matti Hagelberg, Kaarina Haka, Hannaleena Heiska, Minna L. Henriksson, Essi Kausalainen, Mikko Kuorinki, Tuomas A. Laitinen, Maija Luutonen, Leena Nio, Oskari Parkkinen, Vesa-Pekka Rannikko, Maiju Salmenkivi, Anna Tuori, Katja Tukiainen, Timo Vaittinen. Size 21 x 17 cm, 160 full colour pages, perfect bound, edition of 500 copies, published by Napa Books 2012. Follow the studio blog here: helsinkistudios.tumblr.com/´

name: Napa Sketchbooks
description:
Perfect bound pocket size sketchbooks for drawings and writing down your ideas. Cover designs by Jenni Rope, Nene Tsuboi and Matti Pikkujämsä.

Size A6, 80 pages

name: Momo Maker Models
description: MOMO is an artist that works outdoors with systems and homemade tools. MOMO began to illustrate shapes used with the MOMO Maker as though they were real 3-D forms, with shadows and perspective. So then he thought, why not create these forms as little marionettes, light them, and have a real look. Born in San Francisco, MOMO has traveled most of his life, currently keeps a studio in New Orleans. 38 pages, black & white, 5.5″ x 8.5″ numbered edition of 200. Made in Miami 2011. www.momoshowpalace.com

name: Nene Tsuboi: Proposals # 2
description: Proposals is a series of projects related to built environments and building culture. This is the second book about a public sauna. Nene Tsuboi and her partner Tuomas Toivonen are currently building one in Helsinki! You can follow the process in the blog: kulttuurisauna.posterous.com Size A6, 40 pages, perfect bound Edition of 750 copies, 2012 Printed in Finland www.nenetsuboi.com

name: Keltainen kaupunki / Yellow City
description:
Keltainen kaupunki / Yellow City (Illustrated stories from Helsinki) is a book combining Helsinki stories with top Finnish illustrations. For the book project, 17 illustrators invited their favourite Finnish author for collaboration. Amazing pairs were created:

Anna Virtanen & Satu Manninen
Christer Nuutinen & Pauliina Haasjoki
Elina Minn & Emma Puikkonen
Ilja Karsikas & Antti Nylén
Jaakko Pallasvuo & Kaisa Ijäs
Janne Harju & Tuomas Nevanlinna
Jenni Rope & Silja Järventausta
Jenni Tuominen & Tomi Kontio
Jukka Pylväs & Antti Tuomainen
Jussi Kaakinen & Markku Kaskela
Jussi Karjalainen & Leena Parkkinen
Kasper Strömman & Anna Tommola
Kati Rapia & Riikka Ala-Harja
Ossi Pirkonen & Maria Candia
Pauliina Mäkelä & Tiina Lehikoinen
Riikka Sormunen & Juho Nieminen
Terhi Ekebom & Anni Sinnemäki

Texts in Finnish and English
Hard cover, 14,5 x 20,5 cm, 280 pages
Published by Napa Illustrations, 2012
Edition of 1000

name: Jenni Rope: Stills
description: "Stills" contains still images and unused clips from Rope's stop-motion animation "Tiikerimuuri", 2011. The book also features a flipbook on the left-hand side pages. Size 12,5 x 9 cm, 72 pages Edition of 300 Jenni Rope is an artist & publisher of Napa Books, based in Helsinki. www.jennirope.com

name: Terhi Ekebom: My New Boots
description:
The latest fun flipbook by Helsinki-based artist & illustrator Terhi Ekebom.

Size 8 x 9,5 cm, 140 pages
Published by FifiKirja, 2012

name: Terhi Ekebom: Sweet Home
description: The winner of the Napa Flipbook Competition 2011! 144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm, 2011 www.madeinhurry.com/terhi/

name: Joost Stokhof: Sixty Seconds of Fame
description:
On Saturday 19 March 2011 polar bear Knut died in his enclosure's pool at the Berlin zoo. For this book Stokhof drew every second of the last minute before the fall. All drawings were made within one minute.

Joost Stokhof is an illustrator based in Utrecht, Netherlands.

This flipbook won the 2nd prize in the Napa Flipbook Competition 2011

www.thethingsweare.com

name: Elina Minn: Pyjama Infinity
description: This is the winner of the honorary prize in the Napa Flip Book Competition 2008! Elina Minn is an illustrator & artist based in Turku, Finland. 144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm, 2008 www.elinaminn.com/

name: Mänttä Art Festival Catalogue 2012
description: Mänttä Art Festival is an event of contemporary art representing Finnish visual art made by the artists of today. The festival is arranged yearly during the summer at Mänttä, Finland. The exhibition catalogue of the Mänttä Art Festival 2012 shows us documentation of the 40 artists' studios & inspiration behind the artworks in the exhibition. Includes an essay by Antti Nylén. Edited by the curator of this year's exhibition, artist Ilona Valkonen. Featuring artists: Suzanna Asp, Anders Bergman, Maija Blåfield, Linda Granfors & Aura Hakuri, Emma Helle, Marjatta Holma, Jussi Juurinen, JOKAklubi (Niina Lehtonen Braun, Mirka Raito and Tellervo Kalleinen), Sanna Kannisto, Kerijät (Liisa Haverila and Eeva Riikonen), Olli Keränen, Niina Lehtonen Braun, Luuorkesteri, Heikki Marila, Heini Matveinen, Irmeli Mäkilä, Janne Nabb & Maria Teeri, Antti Oikarinen, Mimosa Pale, Jaakko Pallasvuo, Eeva Peura, Kati Rapia, Jenni Rope, Jukka Rusanen, Jukka Rusanen & Mimosa Pale, Hanna Saarikoski, Seval Sener, Tuomas Siitonen, Pia Sirén, Tatu Tuominen, Heli Vehkaperä, Guido van der Werve, Laura Wesamaa, Annu Wilenius, Denise Ziegler. www.mantankuvataideviikot.fi

name: Michael Swaney: The Performances
description:
Michael Swaney (1978) is a visual artist based in Barcelona. His collages, sculptures, drawings, videos, and installations explore absurdity in everyday domestic situations. This books collects his drawings and collages, published by Stickit from Netherlands. 

www.michaelswaney.com

name: Snippet pendant
description: Snippet pendant made by Finnish designer Katri Inkeri. Available in 3 colours: black, brown and white. Lenght: 65 cm Material: Synthetic fibers, 2nd hand leather, gold coloured brass

name: OK Talk – Helsinki/ London
description:
OK Talk brings together designers, artists and theorists operating in Finland and Britain to talk about emerging questions in design philosophy and strategic design. This book documents the first set of OK Talk events, with views on spatial practice, strategies of participation and the crossing of boundaries between design, art and other fields.

143 b/w pages, size 17x24 cm, in english

Edited and published by www.ok-do.eu

name: Scrollster: By eggs or by Bacon
description:
Scrollster is an ongoing project between Michael Swaney (1978, Canada) and Stephen Smith (1975, UK) exploring the potential of collaborative art practice and different compositional stategies.

This handbinded zine was published on the occasion of the Scrollster exhibition at Napa Gallery / Bookies Festival in Helsinki, April 2012. Laser printed, 46 pages, first edition of 10 copies.

name: Finland Children's Rooms
description:
Children's rooms are full of old things, toys and furniture, treasured by the families for generations. With the help of their creative fathers and mothers children's rooms are turned into an expression of individual style and modern taste. "Finland children's rooms" is full of the most dearest treasures, family stories and children's happy smiles. A Helsinki guide with favorite places for children is included in the end of the book.

Published by Japanese publisher Paumes.

Format A5, 128 pages, written in Japanese

name: Timo Vaittinen: Finntrip 1988
description: Napa Books' A5 art book series continues with a book by one of Finland's most interesting upcoming artists, Timo Vaittinen. Finntrip 1988 shows his new work, weird and wonderful colour collage paintings and xerox works. 64 colour and monochrome pages, 15x21cm, edition of 300 copies, 2011 www.timovaittinen.net

name: Pidoux & Fleury: A grey and muddy river
description:
"A grey and muddy river" is a book by Emmanuelle Pidoux & Frédéric Fleury. Pidoux's drawings and  Fleury's photographs tell a story of abandonment, of urban environment left untouched, allowing the time to leave it's mark on things; electric box covered by moss, rusted iron pipes and washed away colors.

Edition of 300.

100 pages
15 x 21cm

name: Manner'S Double-pocket Purse
description:
Tiny purse with two equal sized pockets by Helsinki designer Sari Manner. Made from recycled leather. 

Approximate measures: 15 x 15 cm
Shoulder strap Length: 120 cm

name: Terhi Ekebom: Honeymoon Island
description: Honeymoon Island is Terhi’s third graphic novel. She has used a special ink and etching technique to build up the five touching stories about troublesome relationships and brake-ups. Love is a mess! www.madeinhurry.com/terhi/

name: Nuno Neves: Finlandia
description:
Why do Finns have such great smelling hair? What do they always carry in their pockets? All the answers can be found in the 93 entries of this book, which has already been considered as “The Complete Illustrated Encyclopaedia of Finnish Knowledge”.

Language: Portuguese, English, Finnish. Three colour offset print.
Size 16,7 x 20,8 cm, 64 pages

name: Sissi braid necklace
description: Beautiful braid necklace made by Finnish designer Katri Inkeri. Available in 3 colors. Length: 80 cm Material: Synthetic fibers

name: Tuukka Kaila: Fleeting
description:
Tuukka Kaila is a Finnish photographer who is interested in the role of photograph as the capturer and the modifier of time. The main themes in his photographs are the subtle fleeting moments and phenomenons. Kaila observes the reality of everyday life: “I photograph the world around me to see what the world looks like in my photographs.” After years of living and working in Tallinn and London, Kaila resides at the moment in Helsinki.

Softcover, 52 pages, Size 23.5 x 17.2 cm, Published by Lugemik.

name: Jenni Rope: Wednesday
description: Wednesday is a flipbook by Helsinki-based artist & publisher Jenni Rope. This is one of the first flipbooks we've printed! Size 8,5 x 5,5 cm. First edition in 2003. www.jennirope.com

name: Kati Rapia: Miracle Baby
description:
One of the first flipbooks we've made, and an all time favourite!

Limited edition 2012 - Peach cover!

144 pages, Size 8,5 x 5,5 cm. First edition in 2005.

name: Samuli Otto-Henrik Saarinen: Hyrsky
description:
This is the flipbook that won the Napa Flipbook Competition in 2010! 
Samuli Otto-Henrik Saarinen is a young illustrator & graphic designer living in Helsinki.

144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm, 2010

name: Renaud Perrin: Volcano
description: This is the flipbook that won the Napa Flipbook Competition in 2009! Renaud Perrin is French illustrator working on books for children and adults. 144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm, 2009 perrin.renaud.free.fr/

name: Stine Illum: Friends
description: This is the winner of the Napa Flip Book Competition 2008! Stine Illum is an illustrator based in Copenhagen, Denmark. www.stineillum.dk

name: Nene Tsuboi: Nice to meet you
description: Nene's brilliant flipbook featuring Tanuki and onara! 144 pages, size 8,5 x 5,5 cm. First edition in 2007. www.nenetsuboi.com

name: Jenni Rope: Untitled
description: Untitled is a collection of Jenni's mysterious black & white drawings and collages. Size A5, 24 b/w pages, 2010 www.jennirope.com

name: WMD Fanzine
description:
The international post-graffiti collective WMD made it’s first gallery appearance at Napa Gallery in October 2010. This is the catalogue collecting the best of the show: drawings, photos and paintings by more than 20 artists around the world including Honet, Petro, Egs, Poe etc. 

48 b/w pages, size A3. 
Limited edition of 400 copies, 2010

name: Finland Apartments
description:
Finland Apartments takes you on a tour to 16 inspiring homes of artists and creative minds such as Sasha Huber & Petri Saarikko, Hella Hernberg and Ilona Hyötyläinen & Teemu Hämäläinen to name a few. Wonderful photographs of beautiful homes of different kinds.

Published by Japanese publisher Paumes.

Format A5, 128 pages, written in Japanese

name: Finland Family Style
description:
Finland Family Style takes a peak into 16 beautiful homes of Helsinki designers, artists and architect families: Maija Louekari & Kasper Strömman, Mari Talka & Mikko Summanen, Maiju Salmenkivi & Aleksi Tolonen among others. The book also contains a wonderful Helsinki guide for markets, museums, cafées and home decorating shops.

Published by Japanese publisher Paumes.

Format A5, 128 pages, written in Japanese

name: Tokyo Home Ateliers
description:
This book lets you take a tour around the home ateliers of 17 female artists and designers based in Tokyo. These wonderful spaces vary from being serene to being a designed chaos. What they all have in common are the numerous beautiful objects of inspiration and colourful details to please the eye.

Published by Japanese publisher Paumes.

Format A5, 128 pages, written in Japanese

name: King Nosmo: Around the World
description: See the world through the eyes of King Nosmo! When you shift focus from the monumental to the mundane the cities come alive in ways often overlooked. King Nosmo knows how to enjoy found shopping lists, photographs, abandoned bicycles and graffiti, only to mention a few. 150 colour pages, 13,50 x18 cm, 2005 www.kingnosmo.com

name: The King Nosmo Cookbook
description: Do you know how to appreciate a nice kebab sign? Then you're in for a treat: because here you'll find pictures of panda shaped biscuits, exotic ice cream wrappers and a variety of empty pizza boxes! 96 colour pages, 13,50 x18 cm, 2009 www.kingnosmo.com

name: My Dream Furniture
description:
Imaginary furniture catalogue and a postcard book with illustrations by 8 artists: Terhi Ekebom, Jussi Karjalainen, Pauliina Mäkelä, Kati Rapia, Aapo Rapi, Jenni Rope, Kasper Strömman and Nene Tsuboi.

The artists all had their personal take on the theme ‘My Dream Furniture’ through a series of three postcards each. This resulted in plans for furniture, fantasy worlds and three-dimensional illustration, effortlessly combining design, comics and illustration.

24 postcard book, Size 17x17 cm, printed with brown ink, 2007

name: Napa Postcard Set
description:
4 postcards by Samuli Otto-Henrik Saarinen, Elina Minn, Terhi Ekebom and Jenni Rope.

Size 10 x 15 cm

name: Jaakko Pallasvuo: How you should make cement for mending stones
description: This beautiful book includes the essence of the Jaakko's first zines: Pegasus Dwarf Irregular Galaxy (Kaugummi Books, 2008), Sans Toit Ni Loi (Kaugummi Books, 2008), Kievan Rus (DIY zine, 2009), but it has lots of previously unreleased work aswell. Size 14 x 20 cm, 120 pages, Printed with brown ink, 2009 www.jaakkopallasvuo.com

name: Pala pendant #1
description: A handmade unique pendant made by Helsinki-based artist Jenni Rope. Materials: 3 pieces of MDF board Size of the biggest piece 7 x 10 cm Painted with acrylic paints, varnished Chain length 90 cm www.jennirope.com

name: Jenni Rope: Pallopostia
description: This book combines abstract tape works and short prose texts, and turns them into a very special art book. Still landscapes, wild architecture, stories of intimate little moments, travel stories, letters to you. Picture book, 24x23 cm, 2008 www.jennirope.com ENGLISH VERSION SOLD OUT! ONLY FINNISH VERSION IS AVAILABLE!

name: Nene Tsuboi: Marumaru Mugs book
description: Marumaru mugs is a collection of unique designs for mugs by Nene Tsuboi. She has made them at Arabia Factory in collaboration with Iittala, in 2008. The original mug is designed by Kaj Franck in 1952 for Arabia. Nene Tsuboi is one of our favourite designers, she is based in Helsinki but originally from Osaka, Japan. www.nenetsuboi.com

name: Jenni Rope: My Forest
description: This little catalogue collects Rope's paintings made for the My Forest exhibition touring in Chicago, Berlin and Tokyo in 2009 - 2010. It also works as an intimate documentary introducing us to her studio, ways of working and sources of inspiration. 20 colour pages, 14,8x21 cm, 2009 www.jennirope.com

name: Jenni Rope: Mitä teet viikonloppuna?
description: Arguably as close to poetry as a graphic novel, this last book in the weekend series sees Jenni's illustrations turn more abstract as the story takes a more poetic direction. Free flowing water colour on sturdy pages makes this book a beautiful object of art. Size 18x18cm, 2006 Finnish and English texts. www.jennirope.com

name: San Francisco Kitchens
description:
San Francisco Kitchens invites you to wonder through the kitchens of an inspiring group of creative individuals based in San Francisco. The book also contains a fabulous guide to San Francisco Farmers' Market, food stores and lovely kitchenware shops. 

Published by Japanese publisher Paumes.

Format A5, 128 pages, written in Japanese

name: Ateliers de Paris
description:
This book takes a look at Paris’ finest studios, of all shapes and sizes. Big, small, minimalist, colourful, neat and tidy, some bursting to the brim. 

From the inspirational Artists’ Studios book series by Japanese publisher Paumes.

Format A5, 128 pages, written in Japanese

name: Terhi Ekebom: Voyage
description: Have you ever been to a rain forest? Terhi wouldn't even want to go. Her rain forest is an imaginary place, romantic with a little hint of danger. Voyage works as the epilogue to 'The Christmas Orchid', a thicker book coming up in 2011. Graphic novel, 28 colour pages, 15 x 21 cm www.madeinhurry.com/terhi

name: Aapo Rapi: Pullapoika / Doughboy
description:
The debut graphic novel of Aapo Rapi is a classic coming-of-age tale of the young and idealistic Doughboy who turns against his father, the factory owner. Watch Aapo bring the characters alive through his vivid and skillful use of ink. 

With Finnish texts and english subtitles.
Printed with brown ink, 18x18cm, 2005
